Confessions Of A Crazy Lady: Part 1 The names have been changed to protect the innocent(me). Irene is the daughter, and from here on, I will be naming the mother "Julianna." -1- Over the last 18 years, I have been hospitalized 10 times, ostensibly for paranoid schizophrenia. That it hasnt been more often may be hopeful. I tend to feel my problem is chemical because I know I wouldnt bring it on myself. My last hospitalization began October 17, 1982, and ended January 6, 1983, so its been 14 months since I was discharged, and 13 months since Irene came home. I am now taking 10 milligrams proleyxien(?) and 2 milligrams cogertin(?). I like the proleyxin(?). It has helped tremendously. And although I dream of being off medication, staying on even just a low dosage may be the real way to make my Dreams for my life come true. -2- My problem began when I was in my junior year of college. I was at Princeton University that year. Maybe it was more than I could handle. My parents had worried that it would be, and they didnt want to see me hurt. I started hearing voices my second semester at Princeton. When finals came, I was unprepared. I went to the infirmary instead of to my exams. My grades were estimated after one class was dropped, and on arriving home I was evaluated to be acutely schizophrenic. Since then the schizophrenia has become a chronic problem and has been diagnosed as paranoid type. -3- Irene had some trouble adjusting to 4th grade at Wilder (?) Elementary, and I believe it was that she picked up some of my depression. Her teacher prodded her and I helped her with her work, and by now her teacher has lots of good things to say about Irene, including a compliment for all the reading Irene does outside her schoolwork. Now whenever Irene brings work home I help her with it. Now she brings it home instead of letting it pile up at school. I have always gotten compliments on Irene and for the way Ive raised her. -4- My mother has said, since my last hospital trip, that perhaps now Im well enough that I wont have to go back. My high school French teacher, who lit prayer candles for me whenever I was in the hospital, said we all have to suffer some it seems. She said maybe I had had my share of suffering by now, and that maybe I wouldnt have to suffer anymore. Maybe I wouldnt have to go back to the hospital any more. Howie Williams, a friend of 28 years, says Im sounding better now than I ever did. -5- I have a fine young physician whom I see every two weeks for about 15 minutes. He is intelligent, (?), and has an easygoing optimism. He knows how very much I love Irene, and that I dont ever want to be parted from her unless it be a normal thing concurrent with her growth. Most of my sharing with Irene is spontaneous. Shell say lets do thus and so, and if I can work it out, we do it. I enjoy pleasing her, but I wonder if we shouldnt have a weekly schedule so shed know what to expect.

COMING SOON! My brother found a dumpster full of old journals and letters of a crazy woman who went to school at Princeton. He saved quite a few journals and a pile of letters for me. My plan is to post the contents of those letters online under assumed names (to avoid legal trouble), and let you guys (if anyone still reads) follow the trials and tribulations of a real live crazy woman over the past 30 years. Does it sound too evil of me? Will anyone read if I do it? Will you hate me forever and call the cops? Whatever the case, if one person is interested, I will do it. Gawrsh, I'm evil. :)

My shitty semester thus far. One of my classes, well, the professor has been teaching for about 50 years, and he's grown senile. He rambles on endless tangents about how things in his life relate to a story, but nothing he says is on the tests or quizzes or in papers. However, when people stopped coming, he got pissed and threw a pop quiz. Well, it's in the morning so I'm tired, I can't think fast enough so I don't turn the quiz in, because he snaps through them. I'm not very good at thinking on the spot. That brings me to my next class... but I gotta finish with this one, first. My TA doesn't speak very good English. She knows English well, for she's a Literature TA. However, she speaks slowly and methodically, and she only knows the letter of the language, therefore is entirely rigid in her criticism. She grades everything with a checklist and is very strict and anal, with no leeway at all. Not only that, but she's... well, she's not very aware. For one, she had two papers assigned on the same day. For two, on Monday I got to class way late because of traffic, so I I left my paper in her mailbox since i didn't want to go into class with 5 minutes left... so she sent an email TODAY saying that the paper was due THURSDAY, because on MONDAY we had classmates look at it, but she didn't say anything! I left a note on my draft and left it at that, thinking that she would contact me if there was anything I should know -- my excuse was on the paper, the paper was turned in, what more was there? But there was more, but she said nothing of the sort, and now I'm potentially fucked. I really don't like that class, not at all. Nor do I like my other class... My Brit Lit class, first of all, the readings are so horribly dense my attention span won't allow me to finish any of them. They're these horrible Victorian British essays about random shit and they make my eyes bleed --they're all one paragraph! But that's not the worst part. One worst part: The professor saw me with my feet up, as the desktops in the auditorium are set up for righhanders and I'm a lefty, I have to sit awkwardly which is shit on my bad back, so I sit in the middle and put my feet up. He didn't appreciate it and called on me in the big class twice in one class. I can't handle being put on the spot, as I said before, and I froze up. Embarassed myself completely. Twice. It was horrible. Bean = not very confident in public social situations. :p Speaking of social situations, another social situation problem. I don't know ANYTHING about college ettiquette(sp). A girl I had a class with last semester, at the beginning of this class, waved me over to sit by her. We sat and talked until class started, but then gradually a guy who was in the class with us but who never liked me starts talking to the girl more and more, and since he's forceful and rude, and I am not... I get left holding my [expletive] in my hand, while he interrupts me. So I was gone one day with a bad back (I took a muscle relaxer, slept all day), and when I came back he was sitting where I had been sitting... and they're talking the whole time. After about 5-10 minutes, she says hi, asks what's up, and then he interrupts me and they start talking again... so... Today I hear em talking, he had interrupted me again, only this time interrupted me to talk to the girl about a study group for the class. They were talking about it, then invited a girl next to the guy to the study group... and I'm just sitting there like... o_O? Is this a hint? Am I being snubbed here? Yall are college age or above, on average, what would you say? I got dissed like this all through grade school, jr. high and high school. I've had like... zero social experiences in college thus far, and then there's this. What do I do? I could confront her, which would seem lame, as it's always a case of me "blowing something out of proportion," or I could just blow her off completely, or I could make an excuse not to sit by her... but those two seem petty on my part... or I could just sit there and take it, which aint' my style. I would love to know what I did, or if maybe the problem is on my end, if I'm coming across as a dick or whatever, but I hate being here. I'm always here. Why can't the Bean catch a break? :( Spring Break won't be much of a break... like 4 tests/papers the day after. Zuh? This is like, by far the worst semester I've ever had.

It grew increasingly harder to comment and even read some blogs so I just gave up for a bit. That's okay though, I've had lots of school shit to take care of, and a puppy to love (we just got back, she took me for a walk.), so while I would consider my recent spell "apathy," maybe it was just apathy for certain things. I dunno, I'm still not too interested in blogging but a couple of my oldschool homies commented so I figured I would give a shout out. This is no drama, this is just me trying to learn how to deal with drama. I'll be back soon. Maybe I'll just get bored this summer :)

Swallowed: Cheating. It was never my intention to write anything that would come across as some sort of dieting self help book. I didnt want to say this is what I did and it will work for you, too! However some things in our lives happen that we must share. There are some secrets that just cannot remain hidden. If you have been on a diet before, I am sure you have heard the term cheat day being used. That is to say, once a month or once a week, or once a whenever, you are allowed to eat whatever you want, as long as you stick to your diet. If you maintain this schedule, and maintain it well, I guarantee you will see results. But enough about you, lets talk about me. Without a cheat day, I wouldnt have lost twenty pounds, tops. I would have been the same ball of fat I always was, because honestly, I couldnt eat what I was supposed to eat. Sandwiches without mayo? Anything without cheese? Please. Life looked bleak when I decided to change my life (I almost said when I started my diet, but I keep reminding myself, this is no diet). The first day I started eating right was when I went to the Minnesota state fair. If youve ever been to a state fair (yes, you will spend a lot of time in my shoes in this chapter), you would know that you cant exactly diet there. I always wanted to try a deep fried pickle and deep fried macaroni and cheese on a stick and deep fried alligator. But I had made the decision and I would stick to it. I spent an entire day walking in circles, and all I had to eat was an ear of corn. I drank a little iced tea, but it happened to be sour or rotten, so I was left with my ear of corn. Some people were impressed, others were afraid. I didnt eat anything? That cant be healthy; but I was gung-ho. The first week I did a lot of starving myself. I felt that to keep under my allotted 1500 calories, I couldnt eat much of anything. I would do some work, and this was August were talking, but the heat was too much and I would get woozy. I would have to eat something, and gain my strength. It took me a while to learn moderation. Even after I learned it, I only practiced it loosely. I only ate the bare minimum as my way of saving up for the proverbial pie in the sky. You know, if you live right on earth you get to achieve eternal bliss in heaven? The cheat day is kind of like that. You eat your high fiber cereal in the morning followed by lots of vegetables and fish, turkey and chicken later on, you deserve a reward. Friday comes, and its like youve been being good all winter, and Christmas happens once a week: You get to indulge in your weakness. For me it was Mexican food. I cannot live without burritos. Unfortunately, tortillas are extremely high calorie and are made with lard. They are usually filled with cheese, sour cream and guacamole, in addition to the meat filling. Burritos are bad, hence the cheat day. Chipotle burritos. If you have ever had a Chipotle, you understand the addiction. If you missed it, that was the third time I did that. Anyway, as long as I ate bad, bad food throughout the day, I rewarded myself with a nice big burrito on Friday. I didnt exactly get what I used to get, mind you; I needed enough to satisfy me, not to gorge me. Gorging is a thing of the past. I am, and was, above it. No sour cream, no cheese, no meat. At first, only the tortilla, black beans, rice, veggies and guacamole. Later on, I replaced the tortilla with meat. When you do the math, the calorie trade-off is pretty similar. The important thing was the flavor. Two servings of hot salsa instead of one, that was key. Without hot sauce, the current me would not exist. Hot sauce: zero calories, and can make even the blandest steamed veggies palatable. Somebody should bottle it and sell it, they could make a fortune. To have a cheat day, it is a reward for a long week of eating well. Ive already alluded to that. However, thats not the only benefit of the cheat day. When I was at my biggest, I used to just wait for the next meal. I basically lived for the next meal. At night, I anticipated breakfast; at breakfast I anticipated lunch, and so on. From day to day, I anticipated when I could have the next burrito, or fried chicken with pepper jack, mayo, bacon, fried bred melt sandwich! The world is full of so many flavors, and we dont have long to live. We have to live for the moment. We need to appreciate each meal as it comes, or we could miss out! However, my meals seemed to coincide quite a bit. What that means is, I didnt exactly get a lot of variety. When you eat the same heart-clogging thing three or more times a week, the days seem to all melt into one. Every single day I went without my beloved spicy pork burrito seemed like an eternity. To lose 140 pounds or more would take far too long I counted in days. Before I decided to change my life, I always counted in days. Where would I be tomorrow? Shit, where would I be in a few hours when it was lunchtime? But then I started living for the cheat day. Friday became the focal point of my life. Where would I be on Friday? Where would I go to eat? Friday would be my special day to eat whatever I want. Friday would be great. When I started living for Fridays, the weeks started to float by like days. Four weeks in a month turned into four days in a month. Four Fridays. It is that simple. When you live for your next meal, if you only eat I mean truly eat four times in a month, you are set. I was set. Before I knew it, here I am. The time flew by. As smart as I like to think I am, it wasnt hard at all to trick myself. The part of me that loves food is not rational like the rest of me; it is easy to trick. The worst thing about eating the same thing several times a week, is that it all blends together. What that means is, if someone came up to me and asked when was the last time you had a burrito? I wouldnt be completely sure. After all, I had eaten the exact same thing several times in a week. How could I possibly differentiate? Its difficult to remember your meals from one day to the next; that is why you are supposed to keep a journal when you diet. I dont do journals, so I thought, fuck that. Instead, I employed the trusty cheat day. How hard is it to remember one day a week? Not just any day, but the one day you spent six days waiting for! Imagine having one cheat day a year, if you could afford it. The significance would be greater. However, I, nor anyone else for that matter could live off one cheat day a year; thats insane. One week it was one glorious week of eating whatever the hell I wanted (in moderation) followed by six more days of healthy living. It was towards the end of last August that it all began. The great big coup. The existence-defining moment. I used to merely exist. I was an afterthought. I would be the one who would tag along with my mom, or my dad, or one of my brothers to an event. Nobody ever came to see me, because they had seen me, and once is enough with a three hundred and forty pounder. When anyone asked about me, it was just yeah thats Scott. Uh yeah. Sometimes they said I wanted to be a writer, or that I was funny. I spent a lot of time on the computer, so I was pretty good with computers. I was at the University of Minnesota. That was who I was. That was everything anyone needed to know about me. I did not have an identity defining moment until the state fair. It became who I was. It was the unattainable goal I set for myself that everyone wanted to see me reach. Each time I lost a significant amount of weight, it became an even bigger deal. Everyone I knew was at a loss for words to use to describe me to compliment me. They were not the only ones at a loss for words. Here I am, a month away from the one year anniversary. Maybe I will lose another 20 pounds this month, or maybe Ill stay where I am. At the end of the day, I lost over 10 pounds a month over the past year, maybe more. Of course, at my biggest, I feared the scale; now I embrace it. The little weight hovering over the 150 is now my identity. Before I went all the way to the end. Now I am under 200 pounds. It has been 11 months and they have flown by so fast you would not believe. When I had lost 40 pounds, it was a landmark. When I had lost 60 pounds it was amazing. At 80 it was unbelievable, and at 90, people talked as though I had reached my goal. One hundred pounds was my goal. 100 Is such a nice number, isnt it? But it was never really where I wanted to be. 20 pounds, 200 pounds, the numbers never mattered to me. All the numbers represent is a defining characteristic. I am the guy who lost over 135 pounds. I am that guy. Im not the guy who lost a ton of weight, who is that guy? Im the guy who lost an entire person. I am the guy who used to be really really really really really really big. I am the guy nobody recognizes. Im the guy people mistake for my brother. Im the guy who is just one of the guys. I am the guy who can be called skinny, despite my considerable belly and love handles. I am the guy people whisper about in a good way. The used to whisper to spare my feelings. Now they whisper because they are proud, and I like to pretend like I am humble.

Swallowed Caught Slipping. By Scott Wenker I put on a brave face and a smile. I aim to be happy and dont let anything get me down. I am a rock for others, and I try my best to keep a smile on my face. I like to keep busy, playing a video game, or going out and doing things to keep my mind occupied. It sounds great, doesnt it? When I come home, I head straight to the fridge. I might just make a stop or two along the way. Maybe there is some fruit left in the fruit basket. If not, there is bread on the counter. If nothing else, there is a jar of peanut butter that keeps getting emptier and emptier. The hunger has returned, and I cant stop it. I make excuses, of course. The scale last week said I weighed 194, which is four pounds shy of me having lost 150 for the year. I went to the state fair on the anniversary, and I ate what I wanted because I was rewarding myself. It was a reward! Well, if its there I might as well eat it I mean, one more thing cant hurt. I can snack, its okay. Im not obese anymore, so I dont have to be so careful. It has been almost a week since my dog ran away. Somebody left her outside early in the morning. When I came down later, she had dug her way under the fence and ran away. I stood there in the doorway with her tag in my hand and cursed. I cursed at the person who left her outside, and I cursed at myself for not being up to watch her. I also laughed at my luck: The night before, my dog, Tara and I fought long and hard. I wanted to put the tag on her, but she attacked me fiercely. She clawed and she bit, and she did everything in her power to keep me from putting that tag on. I gave up for the night and would put it off until the morning. The chance never came. Three weeks before, Tara returned to me. She had escaped four days earlier, and was found almost immediately by a woman who gave Tara to her sister. The lady who now possessed Tara filed a report with the Pound, letting them know she had my dog. I finally got ahold of her and I got Tara back. She was back for a few weeks and things were good. I was treating her better, taking her for walks, and trying to make up for not being there for her. The entire time Tara was gone that first time, I was unbearable to be around. I had never experienced a feeling like what I felt then. I wanted to blame everyone but myself, because I knew I was at fault. I was the last one through the gate, and while I could have sworn I locked the gate, it was wide open when I returned home. Everyone wanted to punch me those three days she was gone. It was nearly impossible for me to be civil. I had no patience for anyone. Finding Tara was the priority. As such, my relationships suffered. People started to hate me. My frustrations were not appreciated. I may have lost my dog, but that did not give me the right to be short with others. After plenty of introspection, I decided that it was in my best interest to let things slide. Just put up a front, and be optimistic for Taras sake. That brings me to the past week. I was infinitely more bearable this time around, despite my beloved dog having run away again. Perhaps I was used to having lost her, which explains the increase in mood. However, it does not explain the increase in consumption. So last night I was preparing for bed when I started thinking about how bad I had been eating recently, and how, at dinner, my brother pointed out that I was being a lot nicer this time. I wondered why, and remembered my original essay, in which I had discussed my childhood rage, and how when it hurt others I swallowed it. Swallowing that rage caused me to feel so empty that I had to fill that hole. I had slipped back into the hole again. Only this time it was different. This time, it was acceptable. My family was actually relieved that I was eating worse. Over the past year, I have become quite strict in what I eat, and what I let others eat. This behavior was unwelcome by all, though they understood why I had to do it. I had to go all-out for the weight loss to work, and it did. But whenever I slip, my family is okay with it, and they say nothing to me. They say nothing, because I have reached a point where I am still chubby, yet I am not immobile, or painfully obese. Maybe they dont want me to be completely fit, or just think I am good enough. Compared to twelve months ago, Im Olympian. Now, more than ever I need help. I conquered the depression that had plagued me most of my life, but that doesnt mean I cant be depressed. I miss my girl, but I am too sad to go after her. I dont even know where to start. I am helpless and desperate. I go out to the kitchen because thats where she used to stay. I open the back door, call out to her, hoping she will be sitting on the steps at my feet. Hoping she would come in and lick my ankles. I close the door in defeat, and open the refrigerator door thats next to the back door. While Im out here, I say to myself, Might as well I dont know if Tara will ever return. I dont know what I will do if she doesnt. Im not sure what I will do if she does, either. The first time I knew it was a fluke, and I would have to be extra careful to stop her from leaving The second time proved that her leaving was more than a fluke. I do not know how to stop her. Shes smart. If she wants to leave, she will. I get ahead of myself, my head swimming in guilt. Its my fault she got away. Im not worthy to own a dog. I have these thoughts whenever I think about her. They will subside in time, sure, but how long will I have to wait? What if I finally move on and she comes back? And then leaves again? And what can I do about all of the things that I am feeling? I want to lash out. I want to find someone to blame other than myself. I want my dog back. I want it to be easy. I dont want to hurt anybody. I want to sleep, shrink away from the world and eat in privacy. Two burritos, a pizza, a nice, big Scooby Doo sandwich maybe a box of something or a bag of something. It wont be so bad if its just snack food. Or maybe lots of fruit. Just leave me alone with my food and my pain. I dont want to get out of the hole this time. I have reached a crossroads: I can lash out, or I can be nice and eat. But there is the third option. The light in the distance. The place Ive never been to before. The place where I can be sad without taking it out on other people, and I dont have to bottle things up. The pain is there and it will not go away if I ignore it, and it will not go away if I drag someone else into it. It will go away in time, and in that time it is up to me to be strong. Its something Ive never done before. Newsflash I am surprised too The last year had nothing to do with strength. All my life I was in pain and I embraced it. I swallowed it and when I wasnt lashing out, I was eating. When I let everything go when I stopped lashing out and I stopped eating like I had been eating, it was me letting go of the pain. I did not deal with it. I did not face my demons. I merely ran away. I hid. I wrote a bunch of essays and told everyone how I had conquered the beast. Everyone believed me, the fools. I merely hid and grew stronger. I gathered my forces. I prepared for the worst in secret. I knew I had not seen pain in my life as others have seen pain. I knew there would come a time when I would feel real pain and not want it to go away, and that would be the true test of my strength that strength I have worked so hard to garner all this time. Tara is gone, and this is the time when I need to be strong. I time will come when I will hurt even worse. Tragedy will strike, and how will I handle it? Will I balloon again? Will I shut everyone out? Will I hurt somebody? Will I hurt myself? The battle is raging inside of me right now. The food is still downstairs, and I am very hungry. My dog is still missing. I see no end in sight. My final semester of college begins in two days. I am not ready. I am still waiting for Tara to return. I want to stay at home and eat and not go to school, but I cant. I have to live my life. I have to face my demon alone. I need to reach that light in the distance. I need to find a way to hurt without hurting, and without swallowing all my pain. I can no longer run away. This is it. Wish me luck.

Help me fix Tara? Hi. As you all know, recently Tara ran away from home. She was found by a lady who took Tara to her sister's house, because she knew her sister liked dogs. Tara had torn her tags off so nobody knew anything about her. I was very sad, and wanted my dog. She ran away on a Saturday, and the pound didn't open until Monday, so I went in on Monday and they said someone said they found a dog fitting Tara's description. Anyway, they called the wrong person, gave me the wrong phone number, so I couldn't get ahold of the lady. I went back in Wednesday early and they called her again, and this time got ahold of her. When I got there I was all :hyper: that I got my dog back... but it's not that simple. The lady said she did not respond to "Tara." I find out later, it's because she named her Lidsey, or Linsey, or something like that. I found out she expected to keep Tara, because she "thought she had been abandoned." She had fallen in love with my dog, and was sad to see her go. So her husband followed us home to see where Tara lives, and the next day she shows up with her dog wanting to see Linsey " -- I mean Tara." She comes around and does a bit of criticizing, telling me to do this and do that, and that everything I learned about training her was wrong. I assume she's right since this is my first dog, and Tara was very calm when she returned. However, I feld bad. The lady said that to train a dog you must establish your dominance over it. You must show the dog that you're bigger and stronger, which means kneeing the dog when it jumps, and throwing a dog on its back. I said I was afraid to, because I just couldn't bring myself to hurting Tara. She said I had to... it's the only way to train her... it's the ONLY WAY she'll learn! But I didn't do it. The lady came back, and she'd do it whenever Tara did something she didn't like, she'd basically scream and yell and force her to the ground. She started saying how she was like Tara's mommy, and how her dog was like Tara's mommy... and all this creepy stuff. She always second guessed me, but like, she had me bring Tara back to her place and let her run around. I wasn't comfortable. I didn't want Tara thinking she was moving back or whatever. Anyway, I just got really really weird vibes from the lady, and was tired anyway, so I pretty much said I didn't like the mixed signals Tara was getting, and wanted to be Tara's owner, since she was getting confused with this lady coming around acting like the dominant female. She got the hint and said she doesn't have to come around anymore, I said she could give me a week or two to get back to normal with Tara, she said okay. Now I'm not so sure. Now I think "never again" seems like long enough. See, Tara and the lady's dog would fight for dominance, as would the lady and Tara, and Tara and another dog living at the duplex in which they live. So basically, Tara does what she's told to do by those bigger and stronger than her. She is submissive. But this lady doesn't have children around. : Today, Tara was in the kitchen and my niece went out there to play with her... but Tara wanted to go for a walk.My niece tried to get out of the kitchen, but Tara would jump up on the gate between the kitchen and the rest of the house and block her way. When my niece tried to get past, Tara would nip. She chased the girl into a corner and would nip at her, and bit her a couple times. She doesn't bite real hard, of course... but she bit. She established dominance over a 9 year old girl. I was taught to train Tara with love and reward, to build a trusting relationship between pet and owner. The lady who found my dog told me that was all wrong. Now Tara is confused. She may be completely torn now. Hopefully, when the lady told me to put Tara on her back, Tara has forgiven me. I have no interest in teaching a dog that I'm its master. I want a friendly dog, not a broken one. How can I undo this? PS: This was less a question, more of a rant.

SHE IS BACK! The pound fucked up, right. They gave us the wrong number so this lady hasn't returned any calls because she didn't get any! Ah! The lady we've been calling probably has been away on vacation. ANYWAY. We go back there today and ask, and they call the lady again, who is home and says it looks like her but doesn't respond to the name "Tara." Of course, it's been what, 5 days and she hasn't been called Tara since then? I'm sure she's gotten used to being called "Girl" or "Puppy" or whatever. So... We go and visit and she's out front with Tara... omg I had a heart attack... we got out and I called Tara and she came to me but was a bit hesitant... like she wasn't sure who I was... but after a few minutes she warmed up to me. I wanted to squeeze the life out of her but it's just kinda hard with the big beast. Anyway... the lady wasn't too happy... she said we did things wrong, first of all letting her go and not having tags on her... :p and then said the collar was too tight, but nobody said anything before! She has a gentle leader, though, and THAT isn't too tight... the lady put the collar on with a leash and that choked Tara, but we don't use the collar to put on a leash, so you know... Anyway, the lady says when she's offered money for her trouble, "oh no, you don't have enough money to cover what she's done..." apparently Tara chewed the arm of a 2100 dollar antique chair and then another one, a big leather recliner which has to be at least what, 600 dollars I'd think. But a lot, nonetheless. So yeah, I felt bad but also thought, "yep, that's my girl." I knew when she disappeared that if someone picked her up that their woodwork was in trouble. Anyway, the lady felt bad, and didn't want to part with Tara... apparently, she worked real hard with her and her other dog got along great with Tara and Tara is a sweetie. I do feel bad, and you know, part of me wanted to let her keep Tara but heh, FUCK YOU that's MY dog. I may not be the best owner... and I may fuck up a lot since she's my first dog... but she's mine! Damn it! It's my girl. I let her maul me when we got home, and we walked around a bit, but I came online to tell some people who have been worried that I got her... by the way, thanks for your concern all yall, and I apologize for being so on edge. I really have not been sleeping well at all, because whenever I sleep I'm having dreams/nightmares about her. But I'm okay now... and I gotta go spend more time with her. Ta ta. :):):)

Tara Update: So a lady told the pound she found a golden dog with pointy ears and blue eyes. (HMMMMMMMMMM) and left her number. The pound called who they thought was her -- was it? Maybe. But fact of the matter is, whoever it was hasn't returned any calls and will not answer her fucking phone. Ever. So... no Tara, still. I don't even know if this is Tara. I WANT TARA BACK. WHY AM I BEING DICKED AROUND. AGH I am so intolerable right now. I hate everyone. My patience is way beyond worn thin. I can't handle this. My girl is missing and I'm not getting answers... I am going insane. :(

Oh, hi. I haven't really been posting much, per se, only uploading stuff I do, like pictures of the family and my girl :( as well as my essays. Well Liv made mention in a comment down VVV there about Tara so I figured I'd let you all know that she ran away yesterday while I was working. She's still gone, and the idea is that if she's still alive, she was either taken by someone (How often do you find such a gorgeous dog with blue eyes?) or animal control was called. The latter has a good chance of having happened, because without tags (she removed them herself), and being such a big dog, people would be afraid of her and call animal control. Remember, she loves people, especially little kids, so if she tried playing with a kid, the kid would have gotten hurt and Tara would be in trouble. God, I want her back. I miss her a lot and now all I can do is think about how I should have been a better owner :( *sigh* anyway... feel free to comment on my essays if you read them... I don't really need encouragement or anything like that, these are creative pieces... so feel free to critique or whatever. Just let me know you're alive.

Swallowed Eulogy I need to set the record straight. I once wrote about my former self, that I killed him, as though he was an insect, or an unsavory character. That is not true, not at all. The old me, while gone, is not forgotten, and most definitely not hated. On two levels, I love who I used to be. Part of me misses it the anonymity, the personal space, the unaccountability. All of that was great, but Im happier without it. I will discuss this further in the future. Right now I aim to reconcile myself to Scott Wenker, circa 2001 AD. I want to give his eulogy. I saw my Auntie for the first time in months recently, and she had to reintroduce me to her son, whom I had not seen, I think, since a year ago. What that means is he had not met the new me, he met the old me. My aunt said, This is your cousin Scott. He used to be really big. Really, really, really, really, REALLY big, give or take a few reallys. The point is, I was reallyreallyreallyreallyreallyreally big. My brother, John was with me at the time, and later commented that it was in poor taste. He felt offended for me, because what she said was an attack. I really didnt have the words to come out and correct him; after all, I appreciate that he cares. Thats the thing, though. My family and friends, the people who know me and knew me then, these people know how to handle the old me. They are still getting used to the new me. They know how sensitive I was, and they were careful to steer everyone clear of mentioning (my weight). They spoke in whispers, (Scott broke a chair today). In a way, just like I grew to appreciate who I was, so did they. Families who have to deal with a handicapped child are a lot better at learning patience and tolerance. My family learned how to deal with obesity. Everyone who knew me, knew all the ins and outs of fat people. Perhaps thats one of the few good things to come out of it all it was a learning experience. Yeah, I can keep telling myself that. The point of it all is that we had all grown attached to who I was defensive. Holy shit, my mom was and is the master of excuses. Why was I fat? Well I broke my leg 12 years ago. She literally absolved me from all responsibility for anything wrong with me anything that Ive ever done or said. Shes good. I hate it now, of course. I desperately wish I had accountability back then, but I cant change the past. I am no longer bitter towards my mom for who I was. After all, she helped out a lot when I lost the weight. She only wanted me to get what I wanted. I guess that before I was ready what I wanted was to stay fat. The fat bubble is a safe place to hide. But the protectiveness of my family for the bigger, fatter Scott, while very touching, is kind of saddening. I assume they are just getting used to the new me, or they just cant quite wrap their heads around the fact that I am not him anymore. I do not want to think that they are attached, that they want the old me back. Its possible I was a lot easier to please; as I have said in the past, just give me a burrito or two and I would crawl back in my hole and you wouldnt hear from me for days. Regardless, Im here and I sure as hell hope its to stay. It is up to my loved ones to deal with that. My nephew Josh and my niece Sam dealt with it amazingly. Of course, Im still fat, thats true. Josh pointed that out to me one day, and I was shocked! Comparatively, Im a fucking waif! But this is child logic, and I appreciate it. I would definitely not want to have to reintroduce myself. Of course, Josh was there with me during the weight loss, and he did acknowledge it he knew I had changed, just never made a big deal of it. God bless him. As for his sister, she hasnt really said anything to me about it. She is getting to the point in her life where her mind is working on a higher level than Joshs, so she knows that my weight is a touchy subject. She doesnt know what to say, or if she can even say anything. I appreciate that as well. I take comfort in people treating me normally. While I enjoy the attention I get, it gets overwhelming and I feel the freak show. Samantha and Josh provide that break. As I wander further and further from my point, I feel the need to wrap it up quickly. My family is defensive of me because who I used to be. They are still defensive of the old me as though he is still a part of the family. Maybe I did kill him, and my family is mourning the loss. But while I have moments when I wish I was fat again, just to have all that extra padding to float through existence, I am very glad that me is gone. I am glad he is gone, and I am not offended when somebody says I used to be really, really, really, really, really, really, really big. Why would I be? I used to shit my pants and was breastfed. I wet the bed and was afraid of the dark. I had imaginary friends and I sounded like a girl. This is all in the past. This is who I used to be. Why should I be ashamed of who I was in another life?

Here is a piece I did for my advanced non-fiction class. I had to relate to a piece of art at a museum. Swallowed Disembodied. By Scott Wenker. Oh, once-proud behemoth, what has become of you? Your body is gone, your air returning it to the earth that bore you. Once fearsome and imposing, once standing tall, once frightening evil away. You once cast a formidable shadow underneath the burning sun. Now you are haloed by it. Look at you. You spent an eternity standing guard, and now you are a work of art. In that place you spent your youth and most of your life, you were left alone. Some would stand before you in reverence or awe, while others cowered in fear. You never looked upon them, however. You looked always forward, never meeting their gaze. You did not want to see the reverence, the awe, the fear. Only to stand there. Alone. Forever. But through some blunt force trauma or the wearing on of years, your body deteriorated into nothing. The once-imposing statue was now just a head. The guardian was no more. When Lord Elgin sacked the Parthenon, it was a proud, imposing building. He removed the marble friezes and put them on display. What once was architecture became art. The monstrous became small You are smaller now than you once were, and all the passers-by look upon you through a new lens. Once upon a time they looked on you in horror and awe. That monster, that beast, towering over them capable of crushing them at any moment. You never moved, not for an instant. But you knew that if you had to, if it was important enough, you would move. Gods help them all when you did. You were the monster. You were the giant. Oh, you once-proud and self-reliant giant. You stood your ground for so long and nobody could budge you. The weight of your body held you down. You kept the greedy little hands at bay. But your body wore down. Youve become small, youve become weak. Those hands that feared you now lift you up like a baby. You are helpless and prone. Your life is no longer your own. They put you on display in a shiny glass box. They invent your history, they tell you what you are and what has become of you. They look at you and think, wow, look at what he is, and they look at all of your flaws. They discuss your face and ponder every crack. Like your sister the Sphinx, you have lived a long, embattled existence. Her broken nose is considered beautiful. You wonder what they would say to your face if you were still the same size. You recall that your flaws, then, were insignificant in your shadow. You think, if she had lost her head as I have lost mine, what would they think of the Sphinx? You can remember when you were a younger statue, how alone you felt. You saw people, but they refused to come near. They stood off in the distance, because you were too big to see up close. Now that you are smaller, you are passed over, crowded, overwhelmed, ignored or scrutinized by a whirlwind of people. You tell them where you came from and what happened to you, but you are separated from them. They cannot hear your voice. These people, they do not fear you anymore. You are no longer regarded as a colossus. In fact, you are hardly regarded at all. Face it. You are just a face. Your body has blown away. You are on display, and its better that way.

Hey, kids. I have less than one month remaining before I retire! I mean graduate! Man, time flies way too fast... Thursday I have my third essay due, then all that's left is to do my final portfolio for my non-fiction class, the final draft of my Senior Paper and the presentation for my senior paper! Then it will be graduation... then Christmas... then New Years then I will try to vacation before surgery. ANYONE WANT TO GIVE ME GRADUATION PRESENTS? :) I got in touch with a friend last week and am having lunch tomorrow... but I saw her today at the bus stop and leaned against the glass right in front of her, because I'm a funny guy. It feels good to know somebody from school. Like, I've been there five years (I know, I know...) and I haven't made any friends. Granted, I've kind of been afraid of people most of those years, but lately I've had NO EXCUSE! Actually I have plenty of excuse, since you know, I've been hanging out with a girl after class every single day, adore her immensely but I'm never going to be able to tell her this. Why? Because I'm a great big loser. Everyone tells me the same thing: "Derr, ask her out!" HA! This is the Bean. That is not in my vocabulary. I respect people too much to ask them out :p I'm pretty sure she won't see this though, thankfully. It would take a lot of work on her part to find it... so if she finds it, it means she's interested, and in that case, I'm glad. :) And if I happen to show her AlphaBean.net in the future, it will mean I grew balls and etc... I'm rambling. My mind has been mush the last few whatevers. I have way too much shit going on in my head, while just a few short years ago it was like... "Wake up... shower... school... sleep." WHAT HAPPENED TO THE GOOD OLD DAYS?

Change of plans! So I got my physical, took three showers last night and this morning, got two hours of sleep, went to the damn place and then the lady was like "Oh... nobody told you!? Oops! He canceled all of his surgeries for today!" So I stood there and didn't talk while the nurse tried explaining what's up, then was like "Yeah whatever," and she said it would be like three weeks... but since my insurance is out, I wasn't happy. But today they rescheduled. Surgery on the fifth! So anyway, I was looking for something for Sarah but I couldn't find it :( So I'm just going to get ready and go visit her. *runs* If I don't see you... happy new year!

ARGH! So Christmas is coming soon, and I haven't done but a smidge of shopping for everyone. I've been busy, and not really interested. But now I am... ...and it's almost too late. :( See, it's funny. I finished my final final. I finished my portfolio. I graduated. I'm done. I sat through the loooooooong commencement which was made enjoyable by the company I kept, then I went to the University president's mansion -- the one he lives in rent-free along with the 360k yearly income -- for being the president. Doesn't even have to teach, the freak. Anyway, I ate a few pounds of dessert bars and several glasses of Strawberry punch before going out for Mexican to the greatest place in the world, ironically named La Cucaracha. I got a margarita the size of my head and when I was done with all that, the night was still young, so I hung out with a fellow graduate and it was an awesome night. Okay, enough about graduation. Now on to the bitching: I did my pre-op physical today, and I'm cleared. The Dr. didn't feel anything abnormal when he rubbed my testicles, except my knee in his groin. I will be OK to get surgeried next Monday! Then, no more typing for meeeeee! This is problematic. It's like, I was not worried at all about my finals or commencement, for one reason or another, but here I am, graduated (potentially), with my whole life ahead of me, but my surgery has me so down. What the hell? I'm being all whiney and gay and weak. It will pass once I get the surgery over with, but until then I need some strength. Any Capricorns out there willing to be my stabilizing force?

So I pride myself on being honest, right? Like, I don't hide anything... everyone knows my baggage, you all know me. I never pretended I wasn't obese or a loser or anything. Yeah, I'm insecure; yeah, I have a big ego and I use the internet to validate that. I don't pull punches and I don't fake things. But then, I get accused a lot of being dishonest, or a liar, or full of shit. And why? Because there are things I just don't know, but I think I know. There are things I feel, believe, think, whatever, at the time, but it changes. My opinion on a subject changes. I explain something one way and realize maybe that's not the way it goes. I am erratic. I cannot hold on to one definition of anything, to one absolute. As far as explanations go, reasoning, feelings, thoughts, it is all dynamic. My thoughts change with the wind. If you are at odds with yourself, does that make you dishonest? If you honestly believe something, but believe something entirely different 30 seconds later, what do you classify that as? How do you deal with it? How do you overcome it? Is it something that can be accepted and lived with? I'm erratic, but I can't lie. The fact that I can't stick to one excuse should be a testament to that. If I was a better liar, when I make an excuse I would stick to it just to keep everyone happy. That would be a lie, rather than utter confusion and fickleness. I never stop thinking, so how can I possibly not change my mind?

Oh man. I hate this. Every time I make a new blog entry, it ends up on another one of my blogs. Blah...guh. I hate it. So here is my last entry, which I posted yesterday. I need a job! All right, so, as you will all notice by my previous post, I had gone a little insane from my shoulder. Other factors factored into it, but basically my shoulder made me feel completely useless, helpless, vulnerable. Which makes me needy. Which makes me whiney. Thankfully, the people who matter were understanding of my predicament, and hopefully in the coming days, as I adjust to the way things are and my shoulder gets better, I, too, will get better. However, last night and today I didn't do my shoulder any favors, taxing it quite a bit more than I should; I'm still supposed to be in a sling for a week or two. But my arm starts feeling good, and then... :( I'm a stupidhead. So... tomorrow is Amanda's baptism; John, my bro is the godfather, Nicole, my cousin, the Godmother. She gets to be Godmother of Josh and Amanda, because the pickins are slim in the chick department in my family I guess. That's okay, though. Josh is all I need. Speaking of Josh, I noticed that the last few days, all I do when talking about kids is gush about Josh. Just how awesome and sweet and smart and hilarious he is, and how it's ALL THANKS TO ME. Not all thanks to me, but I take credit for a lot of it. But yeah, I gush. A lot. It got me thinking, if I ever have a kid, could that kid ever mean more to me than Josh does? I mean, the logical answer is, OF COURSE, it's your kid, it's inevitable! But then, it's scary. Because Josh means everything to me. I miss him... he's not been around very much, and he's been real sad. I need to start driving so I can pick him up and take him places. Yeah.

All right... so it's what, Wednesday? No, it's Thursday. I don't know. I can't keep track. Wednesday I took the bandages off. I took the painkiller catheter out, because it bothered me. I should have left it in. I'm taking Vicodin, and it is making me slow. It is making me stupid. And moody. Maybe it's not the Vicodin... no it's not the Vicodin. It's everything. I'm so weak and dependent right now... I need people to do things for me, but I don't want to hassle them. I know I hassle them, too, so I'm just keeping my mouth shut. I can't open my fucking pill bottles! I am feeling very useless, very weak and very isolated. And to top it off, it feels like I'm not getting sympathy... like it's my fault that I'm depressed. Like I need to change. Yay, that makes it worse. So I want to just close myself off, but I can't do anything by myself. Sarah suggested I see someone, perhaps get medicated. I suppose I should... but then, I don't see the dr. again until the 15th, so that's an entire week until then. So now I'm going to be unbearable, and people will take it personally and hold it against me, and I can't stop it. God damn. All this whining, and all that's wrong with me is a bad shoulder. I guess it just goes to show me that I couldn't handle anything serious. Yay.

The day of reckoning is upon us! Dearest friends, I am currently fighting off the heartburn from some leftover pasta, and buffalo wings from lunch, not willing to lie down as it would make it worse. However, lying down would mean sleeping, and since I have to be up at like 5 for my rescheduled appointment... ...apparently, he was scheduling them in order of their importance, and mine is the first he is doing. I think I'm kind of scared, as far as that's concerned. I mean, granted his other surgeries might be something real minor, but still, I've never even thought of my situation as more or less major than anything else. But now...? Anyway, it will be good. I'll get to come home and have soup and take a nap, and then Sarah will come visit me and I will be the happiest guy ever. And I don't just mean from the drugs. :P Anyway I'm gonna go to bed soon, and just take the two antiseptic soap showers in the morning beforehand... Argh, typing will be so very gay, so I unlikely will be doing any typing at all. Am I scared? No. I just know I'm going to be miserable, and that will be an inconvenience. OK lish me wuck.

Okay yeah I haven't been around, but then I have an excuse. You saw how all my previous posts have been! I hadn't previously gotten better, but I am, I am. I feel pretty good today. I had an all right weekend, hey. I get the feeling all of my weekends from here on out are going to get increasingly better. My birthday weekend is after Jay's birthday weekend, and for Jay's we're going up north for snowmobiling... which I won't be doing, mind you, but it will be fun to be there. Drinking and hanging out or something. Hot tub and all that. Anyway... I am almost at the halfway point in my rehab. ONLY TWO MONTHS LEFT before I'm CLEARED to do ANYTHING I WANT. It will be justabout one year to the day that it took for me to overcome this fucking gay ass stupid argh, shoulder injury. It shouldn't have taken so long, and maybe I'll sue the University of Minnesota for it! Because it seriously hampered my style, but then I'm not exactly going to knock anything that has happened to me recently... since any one of the things happening to me that I hated, could have changed and altered my life for what I would have thought as the better, but then, it might have prevented one of the awesome things that have happened to me... like Sarah. Do I believe in fate or cause and effect? Probably not. But I won't rule it out. I just know a good thing, which negates the bad things. I'm very sleepy right now, but I figured I'd pop something up in case anyone reads this thing anymore. u take care now ok

My birthday is in five days! Anyone still read this thing? Send your cards soonly! So it snowed a lot last Friday, and Friday was when my family went to Lake Superior for a mini-vacation for my brother's 31st birthday. Since John finally got a job, he couldn't shovel, so me, the dummy that I am, shoveled, and am still trying to get my shoulder back into shape. I could hardly move it all weekend. Man, this sucks ass. But May 5th is the scheduled clearance date... hopefully I will survive until then... cause the weather will be great and basketball season will commence! So in sadder news, Tara's brother, Joe was finally given up for adoption. Jay's wife wanted Joe, but refused to ever walk him or train him or anything, so he was a great big wild puppy who had hardly any human interaction. And as such, the lady who adopted him got bit twice in the face, and gave him up. My dad has him now, and chances are, since my dad already has an old dog living with him, Joe is going to be put down. Of course, Dad likes him, so maybe he'll keep him, but... Anyway, I don't really like Joe all that much, but he's Tara's twin brother, so I could look at him and see his sister. Sometimes I see dogs I think are her, and when I really think it's her, I just look away. What do I do if I see her? Demand her back? She doesn't remember me anymore. She'd run away to them . Like I've said before, it's best just to believe she's dead... because whether she's alive or not, the Tara I knew is dead, as she wouldn't respond to that name anymore. :( I'm okay though. I'll take with me the memories to be my sunshiiiiiiiiiiine after the raaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaii aiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii aiiiiiiiii aiiiii aiiiiiiiiiii a aaaaaaaaaiiiiiiin... Woo woo woo my birthday is coming up! I need to do something with my life... post-grad life is booooooooring, and my shoulder shouldn't be an excuse not to be working. Anyone have a job for me? Plz?

I dunno when I'm going to put everything back on my blog, I might just wait until I redo the layout before I bother inserting links and all that other shit.
